segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it's making me feel uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so absorbed in her task, she doesn't even notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the water has been overflowing, and how much damage it's causing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is getting larger, and it's only a matter of time before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of frustration, wishing the woman would just turn around and notice what's happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and it's making me anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around soon, before the situation gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The calmness of the scene outside the window contrasts so sharply with the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a sense of urgency, wanting to warn them of the impending danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's obliviousness is almost infuriating, given the circumstances.
segments.speaker: PAR
